description: The employee_id determines the corporate_username. Each employee identifier must always map to the same corporate username.
The corporate_username determines the email_address. A given corporate username must always be associated with the same email address.
The email_address determines the employee_id. Each email address uniquely identifies a single employee.
The email_address determines the device_id. An employee email address is always associated with the same assigned device.
The device_id determines the device_serial_number. Each device identifier must always map to the same serial number.
The device_serial_number determines the device_id. Each serial number uniquely identifies a single device.
The combination of employee_id and device_id determines the access_badge_id. An employee using a specific device must be associated with a single access badge.
The access_badge_id determines the employee_id. Each access badge must always belong to the same employee.
The combination of corporate_username and device_serial_number determines the device_id. The same username using the same device serial number must always refer to the same device identifier.
The access_badge_id determines the corporate_username. Each access badge must always be linked to the same corporate username.
The employee_id must not be unique. Repetitions are required to test the consistency of username and email assignments.
The device_id must not be unique. Repetitions are required to test the consistency of device serial numbers.
